citations.narrative:
The rabbit enclosure has a large accumulation of feces. The center of the wire enclosure has a pile of rabbit feces which
is approximately 2-3 inches deep, and there is an accumulation of bird feces on the walls and along the inside perimeter
of the pen.
Failure to remove accumulations of excreta from primary enclosures can allow for the spread of disease hazards, create
unpleasant odors, and attract pests.
Primary enclosures for rabbits shall be kept reasonably free of excreta, hair, cobwebs, and other debris by periodic
cleaning.
Correct by April 22, 2025.

There was an accumulation of bird feces within the rabbit enclosure. The feces was observed on the walls, shelters, and
on the perimeter of the floors within the enclosure.
Failure to maintain an effective pest control program can allow for the introduction and spread of disease hazards to the
animals.
The licensee must ensure that a safe and effective pest control program is established and maintained at the facility in
order to control insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests.
Correct by: April 22, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.56(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation. 
The rabbit enclosure has a large accumulation of feces. The center of the wire enclosure has a pile of rabbit feces which 
is approximately 2-3 inches deep, and there is an accumulation of bird feces on the walls and along the inside perimeter 
of the pen.  
Failure to remove accumulations of excreta from primary enclosures can allow for the spread of disease hazards, create 
unpleasant odors, and attract pests. 
Primary enclosures for rabbits shall be kept reasonably free of excreta, hair, cobwebs, and other debris by periodic 
cleaning.  
Correct by April 22, 2025. 
3.56(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
There was an accumulation of bird feces within the rabbit enclosure. The feces was observed on the walls, shelters, and 
on the perimeter of the floors within the enclosure.  
Failure to maintain an effective pest control program can allow for the introduction and spread of disease hazards to the 
animals. 
The licensee must ensure that a safe and effective pest control program is established and maintained at the facility in 
order to control insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests. 
Correct by: April 22, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
